title: Attacker can add arbitrary data to the blockchain without paying gas
steps: Start a regtest node on a remote server to begin mining as a single-node network.
Modify the config on a local node to connect to the remote node and disable mining. Append arbitrary RLP-encoded data to transactions.
Create a new account and send a transaction with the modified data.
Wait for the transaction to propagate and be mined, then verify the extra data is included in the block.
vuln_description: Due to a missing sanity check in Transaction::rlpParse, an attacker can append arbitrary RLP-encoded data to the end of a valid transaction. This data bypasses validation, is propagated through the network, and mined into a block without paying gas or undergoing validation.
reason: The vulnerability involves understanding RLP encoding, transaction validation, and block propagation. The attack requires manipulating transaction data in a non-obvious way to include extra data without affecting the transaction's validity.
